data: CARD Targeted Temperature Management (TTM) Post-Cardiac Arrest (Multiphase)
Targeted temperature management is indicated for comatose patients with return of spontaneous circulation after out-of-hospital cardiac arrest due to pulseless VT and ventricular fibrillation

Inclusion Criteria (ALL must apply)   - Age greater than 18 years   - Witnessed cardiac arrest   - Ventricular fibrillation or pulseless ventricular tachycardia as initial rhythm   - Presumed cardiac origin of arrest   - CPR initiated less than 15 minutes from collapse   - Return of spontaneous circulation (ROSC) LESS than 60 minutes from collapse   - Persistent coma (GCS LESS than 8)

Exclusion Criteria (ANY may apply)   - Temperature LESS than 30 degrees C on admission   - Response to verbal commands after ROSC   - Coma due to cause other than cardiac arrest (e.g. trauma, drug overdose)   - Mean arterial pressure (MAP) LESS than 60 mmHg for more than 30 minutes following ROSC   - Systolic blood pressure (SBP) LESS than 90 mmHg despite vasopressors   - SaO2 LESS than 85% for more than 15 minutes following ROSC   - Known pre-existing coagulopathy   - Pregnancy   - Terminal illness   - Neurological response with GCS of 8 or GREATER
Goal temperature: 36 degC (range between 35.7-36.3 degC), obtain and maintain GOAL temperature of 36 degC within 4 hours of return of spontaneous circulation for 24 hours from INITIATION of cooling
Goal temperature: 33 degC (range between 32-34 degC), obtain and maintain GOAL temperature of 33 degC within 4 hours of return of spontaneous circulation for 24 hours from INITIATION of cooling
Monitor core temperature continuously and document hourly

q1h interval, to check pressure areas
midazolam titratable infusion (1 mg/mL) in NS standard
titrate, IV, 0 mg/h minimum rate, 10 mg/h maximum rate, titrate instructions: to achieve RASS Goal as prescribed
dose range: 1 to 5 mg, IV, q15min, PRN sedation, drug form: inj
10 mg, IV, q5min, PRN sedation, drug form: inj
50 mg, IV, q5min, PRN sedation, drug form: inj
morphine titratable infusion (1 mg/mL) in NS standard
titrate, IV, 0 mg/h minimum rate, 10 mg/h maximum rate, titrate instructions: to achieve RASS Goal as prescribed
dose range: 1 to 5 mg, IV, q15min, PRN other (see comment)
fentanyl titratable infusion (10 mcg/mL) in NS standard
titrate, IV, 0 mcg/h minimum rate, 100 mcg/h maximum rate, titrate instructions: to achieve RASS Goal as prescribed
dose range: 10 to 50 mcg, IV, q5min, PRN other (see comment), drug form: inj
Consider neuromuscular blockade when signs of shivering during protocol AFTER patient is sedated to a RASS Goal of -5
Notify provider if patient shows any signs of shivering during targeted temperature management protocol
Electrolytes Panel (Na, K, Cl, CO2, Anion Gap)

Blood, Timed, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, q8h interval for 3 doses or times
Blood, Routine, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, Routine, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, Timed, Unit collect, q8h interval for 3 doses or times
Routine, Reason: 72 hours post cardiac arrest
Consider consultation with Cardiology, Critical Care and Neurology
RN to discontinue the Cooling Phase after 24 Hours and Initiate the Warming Phase
Targeted temperature management is indicated for comatose patients with return of spontaneous circulation after out-of-hospital cardiac arrest due to pulseless VT and ventricular fibrillation

Inclusion Criteria (ALL must apply)   - Age greater than 18 years   - Witnessed cardiac arrest   - Ventricular fibrillation or pulseless ventricular tachycardia as initial rhythm   - Presumed cardiac origin of arrest   - CPR initiated less than 15 minutes from collapse   - Return of spontaneous circulation (ROSC) LESS than 60 minutes from collapse   - Persistent coma (GCS LESS than 8)

Exclusion Criteria (ANY may apply)   - Temperature LESS than 30 degrees C on admission   - Response to verbal commands after ROSC   - Coma due to cause other than cardiac arrest (e.g. trauma, drug overdose)   - Mean arterial pressure (MAP) LESS than 60 mmHg for more than 30 minutes following ROSC   - Systolic blood pressure (SBP) LESS than 90 mmHg despite vasopressors   - SaO2 LESS than 85% for more than 15 minutes following ROSC   - Known pre-existing coagulopathy   - Pregnancy   - Terminal illness   - Neurological response with GCS of 8 or GREATER
Goal temperature: 36 degC (range between 35.7-36.3 degC), Rewarm at a rate of 0.1-0.5 degC/hr, Avoid temperature greater than 37 degC for 72 hours from return of spontaneous circulation.
Goal temperature: 33 degC (range between 32-34 degC), Rewarm at a rate of 0.1-0.5 degC/hr, Avoid temperature greater than 37 degC for 72 hours from ROSC.

If/when recurrent ischemic symptoms or arrhythmias present, then RN to place order for Electrocardiogram 12 Lead STAT
If/when target temperature reached and on re-warming, then RN to place order for Electrocardiogram 12 Lead
RN to discontinue the warming phase when complete and RN to initiate the maintenance after re-warming phase
Targeted temperature management is indicated for comatose patients with return of spontaneous circulation after out-of-hospital cardiac arrest due to pulseless VT and ventricular fibrillation

Inclusion Criteria (ALL must apply)   - Age greater than 18 years   - Witnessed cardiac arrest   - Ventricular fibrillation of pulseless ventricular tachycardia as initial rhythm   - Presumed cardiac origin of arrest   - CPR initiated less than 15 minutes from collapse   - Return of spontaneous circulation (ROSC) LESS than 60 minutes from collapse   - Persistent coma (GCS LESS than 8)

Exclusion Criteria (ANY may apply)   - Temperature LESS than 30 degrees C on admission   - Response to verbal commands after ROSC   - Coma due to cause other than cardiac arrest (e.g. trauma, drug overdose)   - Mean arterial pressure (MAP) LESS than 60 mmHg for more than 30 minutes following ROSC   - Systolic blood pressure (SBP) LESS than 90 mmHg despite vasopressors   - SaO2 LESS than 85% for more than 15 minutes following ROSC   - Known pre-existing coagulopathy   - Pregnancy   - Terminal illness   - Neurological response with GCS of 8 or GREATER
Resume cooling PRN for greater than 37.5 degC (for maintenance after re-warming)
Goal temperature: Other (please specify), Resume cooling, and maintain below 37.5 degC.
